item.title: Newest
item.dc:creator: @javis javis
item.description:
@javis wrote:

i see the white thing your talking about, i think thats part of the c4d. As for the border ill see what i can do :). On the buildings, that actually wasnt the stock i was looking to put in but the one that i wanted to go there i couldnt find.

On the first one i was rather lost on what to put in. I ended up puting in 2 diffferent c4ds.

Read full topic

item.title: Newest
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

The first is fugly. You need to get rid of the C4D. Use something else, less shell shaded looking. Maybe a Red Brick Wall, or something along the lines of a realistic object.

Second is too dark. The Version 2 of the second is an improvement, and shows all of the detail in the focal. I was drawn more too the building in the background though, because of the repetitive windows scaling down the building. But that isn’t necessarily a bad thing. You need to remove the border, and do a 4 pixel top and bottom border. That one is pretty bad. There is a white looking shape at the bottom left corner, needs the opacity turned down on it. Or deleted.

I have to say they’re both pretty bad. And that isn’t GIMP’s fault. You’ve improved in certain aspects, but are jumping from one sig style to another too quickly. You need to stay with one type for a bit of time, and develop it.

3/10
3.8/10

Sorry for the bad C&C, I’ve been giving really bad C&C lately.

Read full topic

item.title: Newest
item.dc:creator: @javis javis
item.description:
@javis wrote:

I try to keep text as minimalistic as possible. I feal that it has little to do with any of my graphics other than to brand them.

As for it being dark, i noticed the same thing. I personally think that it helps capture the shodows and shading. Both of the stocks i used i had to completely recolor because they where in b/w
